definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: This course of action is advisable.
sentences.chinese: 這當然是一廂情願的海市蜃樓。

sentences.english: I love you just wishful thinking began as stop-motion.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你只是一廂情願一開始就成爲定格。
但那只是一廂情願的想法。

sentences.english: The so-called love, just we wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 所謂的愛情，只不過是我們一廂情願。

sentences.english: Look to reality instead of relying on wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 要着眼現實，而不要依賴一廂情願的想法。

sentences.english: But this seems mostly to be wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 但這看來更多的只是一廂情願的想法。

sentences.english: There's a lot of this going around in emerging markets.
sentences.chinese: 這種一廂情願目前在新興市場很流行。

sentences.english: They cede power with the belief, however wishful, they will be better off.
sentences.chinese: 他們放棄權利，一廂情願地相信自己會過得好。

sentences.english: Aufhebung is one of philosophy's pretty little dreams.
sentences.chinese: 在哲學上，只是一廂情願的美夢。

sentences.english: Sometimes, wishful thinking or self-assertion is in bring trouble on oneself.
sentences.chinese: 有時候啊，一廂情願或者自作多情都是在自尋煩惱。

sentences.english: The so-called miss, just a person's wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 所謂思念，只是一個人的一廂情願。

sentences.english: This, of course, is a fond delusion.
sentences.chinese: 這當然是一廂情願的海市蜃樓。

sentences.english: Many friendship or real love are broken by wishful thinking on my part .
sentences.chinese: 很多感情，都因爲一廂情願最後連朋友都當不成了。

sentences.english: I learnt a lesson from this, after that it was better not to make decision just by one party.
sentences.chinese: 這事令我上了一課，以後做事還是不要一廂情願的好。

sentences.english: Some of those are only one-sided wishful thinking.
sentences.chinese: 有些是一廂情願的自欺欺人。

definition: unilateral/one-sided/home remedy/folk prescription(same as 丹方)/single-drug prescription (same as 奇方[ji1 fang1], one of the seven kinds of prescriptions of Chinese medicine 七方[qi1 fang1])/metaphorically. a good solution
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
